title.narrative: Second Student Loan Support Project, APL Phase I

description.narrative: The development objectives of the proposed program are to (a) improve coverage by increasing the enrollment and graduation rates of students in tertiary education; (b) improve equity by increasing enrollment and graduation rates of tertiary education students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds; and (c) increase and diversify the sources of alternative funding available to ICETEX in order to increase ICETEX's sustainability.

title.narrative: Increase in the number of tertiary education graduates

comment.narrative: Based on information provided by ICETEX, the original baseline was adjusted to reflect MEN's updated data in the October 2010restructuring
Cumulative. The indicator for 2012 has been revised and is still preliminary.

title.narrative: Decrease in portfolio at risk over 30 days as a percentage of total portfolio (portfolio quality ratio)
Increase in the percentage of students enrolled in tertiary education whose income is below twice the minimum salary
Decrease in the annual administrative costs of ICETEX as a percentage of total annual income
Increase in transition rate between secondary and tertiary education

comment.narrative: The calculation of this indicator was discontinued by the Ministry of Education (due to lack of reliability). 75% corresponds tothe latest available data:Number of first year students 2011/number of students that presented SABER 11 in 2010.Sources: ICETEXand SNIES, MEN.

title.narrative: Number of new or upgraded management and IT systems in place
Number of new agreements signed with tertiary education institutions
Number of new students from strata 1 and 2 obtaining an ACCES loan
Number of loan renewals disbursed for needy students through the ACCES program
Number of new students obtaining an ACCES loan

Percentage of total resources available for student credit generated from new external sources (other than ACCES credit, government/ public funding for tuition or interest rate subsidies or equity res
